title: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details
description: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a. Mnemonicsb. No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for the superclass), so it could be done. At least isValidTypeNamef. The label could say 'Select destination type:'g.
OB: When going to the next page, the Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes)c. The title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.e. If the destination type is the same as the source type, refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
EB: I would use the title for 'Move static field(s)' and use the description for 'x fields from xx'd. The selection dialog should be initialized with the type currently entered.h.
SR: 1. Open the dialog for moving static member.2. Click on the Browse button and observe that the button size is too small.3. Enter a long text in the title field and go to the next page to observe that it says 'Type not found'.4. Ensure that only types from the source folders of the own project are shown in the dialog.5. Enter the same type in the destination type field and observe that the refactoring warns about errors and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.6. Verify that the title is used for 'Move static field(s)' and the description is used for 'x fields from xx'.7. Check that the selection dialog is initialized with the type currently entered.
